IP.Name: MBEDTLS
IP.About: MBEDTLS: a light-weight open source cryptographic and SSL/TLS library written in C.

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_RNG_IP
RefParameter.Description:
Using available RNG SW or your own implementation will impact perfomances
Default value: HW RNG when RNG IP is available activated

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_RNG_IP
RefParameter.Description:
RNG IP is available, you should activate it.
Using available RNG SW or your own implementation will impact perfomances
Default value: SW RNG

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_RNG_IP
RefParameter.Description: You can choose between available SW RNG or your own implementation

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_TCP_IP
RefParameter.Description:
TCP/IP stack choice
Default value: LWIP TCP/IP stack when LWIP activated

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_TCP_IP
RefParameter.Description:
TCP/IP stack activation
Default value: No TCP/IP stack

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_HAVE_ASM
RefParameter.Description:
The compiler has support for asm()
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_HAVE_SSE2
RefParameter.Description:
CPU supports SSE2 instruction set
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_HAVE_TIME
RefParameter.Description:
System has time.h and time(). The time does not need to be correct, only time differences are used, by contrast with MBEDTLS_HAVE_TIME_DATE
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_HAVE_TIME_DATE
RefParameter.Description:
System has time.h and time(), gmtime() and the clock is correct. The time needs to be correct (not necesarily very accurate, but at least the date should be correct). This is used to verify the validity period of X.509 certificates.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_HAVE_TIME_DATE
RefParameter.Description:
System has time.h and time(), gmtime() and the clock is correct. The time needs to be correct (not necesarily very accurate, but at least the date should be correct). This is used to verify the validity period of X.509 certificates.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_MEMORY
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the memory allocation layer. By default mbed TLS uses the system-provided calloc() and free(). This allows different allocators (self-implemented or provided) to be provided to the platform abstraction layer.
Enabling MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_MEMORY without the MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_{FREE,CALLOC}_MACROs will provide ""mbedtls_platform_set_calloc_free()"" allowing you to set an alternative calloc() and free() function pointer at runtime.
Enabling MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_MEMORY and specifying MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_{CALLOC,FREE}_MACROs will allow you to specify the alternate function at compile time.
Default value: Enabled(#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_MEMORY
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the memory allocation layer. By default mbed TLS uses the system-provided calloc() and free(). This allows different allocators (self-implemented or provided) to be provided to the platform abstraction layer.
Enabling MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_MEMORY without the MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_{FREE,CALLOC}_MACROs will provide ""mbedtls_platform_set_calloc_free()"" allowing you to set an alternative calloc() and free() function pointer at runtime.
Enabling MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_MEMORY and specifying MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_{CALLOC,FREE}_MACROs will allow you to specify the alternate function at compile time.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_NO_STD_FUNCTIONS
RefParameter.Description:
Do not assign standard functions in the platform layer (e.g. calloc() to MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_STD_CALLOC and printf() to MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_STD_PRINTF)
This makes sure there are no linking errors on platforms that do not support these functions. You will HAVE to provide alternatives, either at runtime via the platform_set_xxx() functions or at compile time by setting the MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_STD_XXX defines, or enabling a MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_XXX_MACRO.
Default value: Enabled(#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_NO_STD_FUNCTIONS
RefParameter.Description:
Do not assign standard functions in the platform layer (e.g. calloc() to MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_STD_CALLOC and printf() to MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_STD_PRINTF)
This makes sure there are no linking errors on platforms that do not support these functions. You will HAVE to provide alternatives, either at runtime via the platform_set_xxx() functions or at compile time by setting the MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_STD_XXX defines, or enabling a MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_XXX_MACRO.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_DEPRECATED_WARNING
RefParameter.Description:
Mark deprecated functions so that they generate a warning if used. Functions deprecated in one version will usually be removed in the next version. You can enable this to help you prepare the transition to a new major version by making sure your code is not using these functions.
This only works with GCC and Clang. With other compilers, you may want to use MBEDTLS_DEPRECATED_REMOVED
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_DEPRECATED_REMOVED
RefParameter.Description:
Remove deprecated functions so that they generate an error if used. Functions deprecated in one version will usually be removed in the next version. You can enable this to help you prepare the transition to a new major version by making sure your code is not using these functions.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_TIMING_ALT
RefParameter.Description:
Uncomment to provide your own alternate implementation for mbedtls_timing_hardclock(), mbedtls_timing_get_timer(), mbedtls_set_alarm(), mbedtls_set/get_delay()
Only works if you have MBEDTLS_TIMING_C enabled.
You will need to provide a header ""timing_alt.h"" and an implementation at compile time.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_TIMING_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_TIMING_ALT
RefParameter.Description:

You will need to provide a header ""timing_alt.h"" and an implementation at compile time.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_TEST_NULL_ENTROPY
RefParameter.Description:
Enables testing and use of mbed TLS without any configured entropy sources. This permits use of the library on platforms before an entropy source has been integrated (see for example the MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_HARDWARE_ALT or the MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_NV_SEED switches).
WARNING! This switch MUST be disabled in production builds, and is suitable only for development. Enabling the switch negates any security provided by the library.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_C & MBEDTLS_NO_DEFAULT_ENTROPY_SOURCES

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_TEST_NULL_ENTROPY
RefParameter.Description:
Enables testing and use of mbed TLS without any configured entropy sources. This permits use of the library on platforms before an entropy source has been integrated (see for example the MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_HARDWARE_ALT or the MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_NV_SEED switches).
WARNING! This switch MUST be disabled in production builds, and is suitable only for development. Enabling the switch negates any security provided by the library.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_C & MBEDTLS_NO_DEFAULT_ENTROPY_SOURCES

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_HARDWARE_ALT
RefParameter.Description:
Your own implementation of a hardware entropy collector.
Your function must be called \c mbedtls_hardware_poll(), have the same prototype as declared in entropy_poll.h, and accept NULL as first argument.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_HARDWARE_ALT
RefParameter.Description:

RefParameter.Description:
Store the AES tables in ROM
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_AES_ROM_TABLES
RefParameter.Description:
Store the AES tables in ROM
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_CAMELLIA_SMALL_MEMORY
RefParameter.Description:

Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Description:

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_CIPHER_MODE_CFB

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_CIPHER_MODE_CTR
RefParameter.Description:

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_CIPHER_MODE_CTR
RefParameter.Description:

Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_CIPHER_NULL_CIPHER
RefParameter.Description:
Enable NULL cipher.
WARNING!: Only do so when you know what you are doing. This allows for encryption or channels without any security!
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_CIPHER_PADDING_PKCS7
RefParameter.Description:
Uncomment or comment macros to add support for specific padding modes in the cipher layer with cipher modes that support padding (e.g. CBC)
If you disable all padding modes, only full blocks can be used with CBC. Enable padding modes in the cipher layer.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENABLE_WEAK_CIPHERSUITES
RefParameter.Description:
Enable weak ciphersuites in SSL / TLS
WARNING!: Only do so when you know what you are doing. This allows for channels with virtually no security at all!
This enables the following ciphersuites:
MBEDTLS_TLS_RSA_WITH_DES_CBC_SHA
MBEDTLS_TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_DES_CBC_SHA
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_REMOVE_ARC4_CIPHERSUITES
RefParameter.Description:
Remove RC4 ciphersuites by default in SSL / TLS.
This flag removes the ciphersuites based on RC4 from the default list as returned by mbedtls_ssl_list_ciphersuites(). However, it is still possible to enable (some of) them with mbedtls_ssl_conf_ciphersuites() by including them explicitly.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_REMOVE_ARC4_CIPHERSUITES
RefParameter.Description:
Remove RC4 ciphersuites by default in SSL / TLS.
This flag removes the ciphersuites based on RC4 from the default list as returned by mbedtls_ssl_list_ciphersuites(). However, it is still possible to enable (some of) them with mbedtls_ssl_conf_ciphersuites() by including them explicitly.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ECDSA_DETERMINISTIC

Require: MBEDTLS_ECJPAKE_C & MBEDTLS_SHA256_C & MBEDTLS_ECP_DP_SECP256R1_ENABLED

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_KEY_EXCHANGE_ECJPAKE_ENABLED

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PK_PARSE_EC_EXTENDED
RefParameter.Description:
Enhance support for reading EC keys using variants of SEC1 not allowed by RFC 5915 and RFC 5480.
Currently this means parsing the SpecifiedECDomain choice of EC parameters (only known groups are supported, not arbitrary domains, to avoid validation issues).
Disable if you only need to support RFC 5915 + 5480 key formats.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PK_PARSE_EC_EXTENDED
RefParameter.Description:

Currently this means parsing the SpecifiedECDomain choice of EC parameters (only known groups are supported, not arbitrary domains, to avoid validation issues).

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ERROR_STRERROR_DUMMY
RefParameter.Description:
Enable a dummy error function to make use of mbedtls_strerror() in third party libraries easier when MBEDTLS_ERROR_C is disabled (no effect when MBEDTLS_ERROR_C is enabled).
You can safely disable this if MBEDTLS_ERROR_C is enabled, or if you're not using mbedtls_strerror() or error_strerror() in your application.
Disable if you run into name conflicts and want to really remove the mbedtls_strerror()
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ERROR_STRERROR_DUMMY
RefParameter.Description:
Enable a dummy error function to make use of mbedtls_strerror() in third party libraries easier when MBEDTLS_ERROR_C is disabled (no effect when MBEDTLS_ERROR_C is enabled).
You can safely disable this if MBEDTLS_ERROR_C is enabled, or if you're not using mbedtls_strerror() or error_strerror() in your application.
Disable if you run into name conflicts and want to really remove the mbedtls_strerror()

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_FS_IO

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_NO_DEFAULT_ENTROPY_SOURCES
RefParameter.Description:
Do not add default entropy sources. These are the platform specific, mbedtls_timing_hardclock and HAVEGE based poll functions.
This is useful to have more control over the added entropy sources in an application.
Default value: Enabled(#define) when RNG is not activated
It can be set to disabled, but this means that the mbedtls library will be built either:
- without any random number generator, which will make the application vulnerable
- with a pure SW random number generator, if the flag “MBEDTLS_HAVEGE_C” is set, but this will be costly in term of CPU and SIZE.

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_NO_DEFAULT_ENTROPY_SOURCES
RefParameter.Description:
Do not add default entropy sources. These are the platform specific, mbedtls_timing_hardclock and HAVEGE based poll functions.
This is useful to have more control over the added entropy sources in an application.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_NO_PLATFORM_ENTROPY
RefParameter.Description:
Do not use built-in platform entropy functions.
This is useful if your platform does not support standards like the /dev/urandom or Windows CryptoAPI.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_FORCE_SHA256
RefParameter.Description:
Force the entropy accumulator to use a SHA-256 accumulator instead of the default SHA-512 based one (if both are available).
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SHA256_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_FORCE_SHA256
RefParameter.Description:
Force the entropy accumulator to use a SHA-256 accumulator instead of the default SHA-512 based one (if both are available).
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SHA256_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_NV_SEED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the non-volatile (NV) seed file-based entropy source. (Also enables the NV seed read/write functions in the platform layer).
This is crucial (if not required) on systems that do not have a cryptographic entropy source (in hardware or kernel) available.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_C & MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_NV_SEED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the non-volatile (NV) seed file-based entropy source. (Also enables the NV seed read/write functions in the platform layer).
This is crucial (if not required) on systems that do not have a cryptographic entropy source (in hardware or kernel) available.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_ENTROPY_C & MBEDTLS_PLATFORM_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_MEMORY_DEBUG
RefParameter.Description:
Enable debugging of buffer allocator memory issues. Automatically prints (to stderr) all (fatal) messages on memory allocation issues. Enables function for 'debug output' of allocated memory.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_MEMORY_BUFFER_ALLOC_C

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_MEMORY_DEBUG
RefParameter.Description:

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_MEMORY_BACKTRACE

Include backtrace information with each allocated block.
Require GLIBC-compatible backtrace and backtrace_symbols() support
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PK_RSA_ALT_SUPPORT

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PKCS1_V21
RefParameter.Description:

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_PKCS1_V21

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_RSA_NO_CRT
RefParameter.Description:
Do not use the Chinese Remainder Theorem for the RSA private operation.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SELF_TEST
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the checkup functions (*_self_test).
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SELF_TEST
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the checkup functions (*_self_test).
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SHA256_SMALLER
RefParameter.Description:
Enable an implementation of SHA-256 that has lower ROM footprint but also lower performance.
The default implementation is meant to be a reasonnable compromise between performance and size. This version optimizes more aggressively for size at the expense of performance. Eg on Cortex-M4 it reduces the size of mbedtls_sha256_process() from ~2KB to ~0.5KB for a performance hit of about 30%.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_ALL_ALERT_MESSAGES
RefParameter.Description:
Enable sending of alert messages in case of encountered errors as per RFC. If you choose not to send the alert messages, mbed TLS can still communicate with other servers, only debugging of failures is harder.
The advantage of not sending alert messages, is that no information is given about reasons for failures thus preventing adversaries of gaining intel.
Enable sending of all alert messages
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_ALL_ALERT_MESSAGES
RefParameter.Description:
Enable sending of alert messages in case of encountered errors as per RFC. If you choose not to send the alert messages, mbed TLS can still communicate with other servers, only debugging of failures is harder.
The advantage of not sending alert messages, is that no information is given about reasons for failures thus preventing adversaries of gaining intel.
Enable sending of all alert messages
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_DEBUG_ALL
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the debug messages in SSL module for all issues. Debug messages have been disabled in some places to prevent timing attacks due to (unbalanced) debugging function calls.
If you need all error reporting you should enable this during debugging, but remove this for production servers that should log as well.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_ENCRYPT_THEN_MAC
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for Encrypt-then-MAC, RFC 7366. This allows peers that both support it to use a more robust protection for ciphersuites using CBC, providing deep resistance against timing attacks on the padding or underlying cipher.
This only affects CBC ciphersuites, and is useless if none is defined.
Default value: Enabled(#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_2

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_ENCRYPT_THEN_MAC
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for Encrypt-then-MAC, RFC 7366. This allows peers that both support it to use a more robust protection for ciphersuites using CBC, providing deep resistance against timing attacks on the padding or underlying cipher.
This only affects CBC ciphersuites, and is useless if none is defined.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_2

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_ENCRYPT_THEN_MAC
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for Encrypt-then-MAC, RFC 7366. This allows peers that both support it to use a more robust protection for ciphersuites using CBC, providing deep resistance against timing attacks on the padding or underlying cipher.
This only affects CBC ciphersuites, and is useless if none is defined.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_2

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_EXTENDED_MASTER_SECRET
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for Extended Master Secret, aka Session Hash (draft-ietf-tls-session-hash-02).
This was introduced as ""the proper fix"" to the Triple Handshake familiy of attacks, but it is recommended to always use it (even if you disable renegotiation), since it actually fixes a more fundamental issue in the original SSL/TLS design, and has implications beyond Triple Handshake.
Default value: Enabled(#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_2

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_EXTENDED_MASTER_SECRET
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for Extended Master Secret, aka Session Hash (draft-ietf-tls-session-hash-02).
This was introduced as ""the proper fix"" to the Triple Handshake familiy of attacks, but it is recommended to always use it (even if you disable renegotiation), since it actually fixes a more fundamental issue in the original SSL/TLS design, and has implications beyond Triple Handshake.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_2

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_EXTENDED_MASTER_SECRET
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for Extended Master Secret, aka Session Hash (draft-ietf-tls-session-hash-02).
This was introduced as ""the proper fix"" to the Triple Handshake familiy of attacks, but it is recommended to always use it (even if you disable renegotiation), since it actually fixes a more fundamental issue in the original SSL/TLS design, and has implications beyond Triple Handshake.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_1 | MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_TLS1_2

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_FALLBACK_SCSV
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for FALLBACK_SCSV (draft-ietf-tls-downgrade-scsv-00). For servers, it is recommended to always enable this, unless you support only one version of TLS, or know for sure that none of your clients implements a fallback strategy.
For clients, you only need this if you're using a fallback strategy, which is not recommended in the first place, unless you absolutely need it to interoperate with buggy (version-intolerant) servers.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_FALLBACK_SCSV
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for FALLBACK_SCSV (draft-ietf-tls-downgrade-scsv-00). For servers, it is recommended to always enable this, unless you support only one version of TLS, or know for sure that none of your clients implements a fallback strategy.
For clients, you only need this if you're using a fallback strategy, which is not recommended in the first place, unless you absolutely need it to interoperate with buggy (version-intolerant) servers.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_HW_RECORD_ACCEL
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for FALLBACK_SCSV (draft-ietf-tls-downgrade-scsv-00). For servers, it is recommended to always enable this, unless you support only one version of TLS, or know for sure that none of your clients implements a fallback strategy.
For clients, you only need this if you're using a fallback strategy, which is not recommended in the first place, unless you absolutely need it to interoperate with buggy (version-intolerant) servers.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_CBC_RECORD_SPLITTING
RefParameter.Description:
Enable 1/n-1 record splitting for CBC mode in SSLv3 and TLS 1.0.
This is a countermeasure to the BEAST attack, which also minimizes the risk of interoperability issues compared to sending 0-length records.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_CBC_RECORD_SPLITTING
RefParameter.Description:
Enable 1/n-1 record splitting for CBC mode in SSLv3 and TLS 1.0.
This is a countermeasure to the BEAST attack, which also minimizes the risk of interoperability issues compared to sending 0-length records.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_RENEGOTIATION
RefParameter.Description:
Disable support for TLS renegotiation.
The two main uses of renegotiation are (1) refresh keys on long-lived connections and (2) client authentication after the initial handshake. If you don't need renegotiation, it's probably better to disable it, since it has been associated with security issues in the past and is easy to misuse/misunderstand.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_RENEGOTIATION
RefParameter.Description:
Disable support for TLS renegotiation.
The two main uses of renegotiation are (1) refresh keys on long-lived connections and (2) client authentication after the initial handshake. If you don't need renegotiation, it's probably better to disable it, since it has been associated with security issues in the past and is easy to misuse/misunderstand.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_HELLO_VERIFY
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for HelloVerifyRequest on DTLS servers.
This feature is highly recommended to prevent DTLS servers being used as amplifiers in DoS attacks against other hosts. It should always be enabled unless you know for sure amplification cannot be a problem in the environment in which your server operates.
WARNING! Disabling this is often a security risk!
Default value: Enabled(#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_DTLS

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_HELLO_VERIFY

This feature is highly recommended to prevent DTLS servers being used as amplifiers in DoS attacks against other hosts. It should always be enabled unless you know for sure amplification cannot be a problem in the environment in which your server operates.

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_HELLO_VERIFY

Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_PROTO_DTLS

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_CLIENT_PORT_REUSE
RefParameter.Description:
Enable server-side support for clients that reconnect from the same port.
Some clients unexpectedly close the connection and try to reconnect using the same source port. This needs special support from the server to handle the new connection securely, as described in section 4.2.8 of RFC 6347. This flag enables that support.
Default value: Enabled(#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_HELLO_VERIFY

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_DTLS_CLIENT_PORT_REUSE

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_SESSION_TICKETS
RefParameter.Description:
Enable support for RFC 5077 session tickets in SSL.
Client-side, provides full support for session tickets (maintainance of a session store remains the responsibility of the application, though). Server-side, you also need to provide callbacks for writing and parsing tickets, including authenticated encryption and key management. Example callbacks are provided by MBEDTLS_SSL_TICKET_C.
Default value: Enabled(#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_SESSION_TICKETS

Server-side, you also need to provide callbacks for writing and parsing tickets, including authenticated encryption and key management. Example callbacks are provided by MBEDTLS_SSL_TICKET_C.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_X509_CHECK_KEY_USAGE
RefParameter.Description:

Disabling this avoids problems with mis-issued and/or misused (intermediate) CA and leaf certificates.
WARNING! Depending on your PKI use, disabling this can be a security risk!

WARNING! TLS-level compression MAY REDUCE SECURITY! See for example the CRIME attack. Before enabling this option, you should examine with care if CRIME or similar exploits may be a applicable to your use case.

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_THREADING_C
RefParameter.Description:
Enable the threading abstraction layer.
By default mbed TLS assumes it is used in a non-threaded environment or that contexts are not shared between threads. If you do intend to use contexts between threads, you will need to enable this layer to prevent race conditions.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
Require: MBEDTLS_THREADING_ALT | MBEDTLS_THREADING_PTHREAD.

RefParameter.Name: MBEDTLS_SSL_CIPHERSUITES
RefParameter.Description:
No dependency checking is done on that field! This option can only be used to restrict the set of available ciphersuites. It is your responsibility to make sure the needed modules are active. Use this to save a few hundred bytes of ROM (default ordering of all available ciphersuites) and a few to a few hundred bytes of RAM.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)

RefParameter.Name: YOTTA_CFG_MBEDTLS_TARGET_CONFIG_FILE
RefParameter.Description:
Target and application specific configurations
Allow user to override any previous default.
Use two macro names for that, as:
- with yotta the prefix YOTTA_CFG_ is forced
- without yotta is looks weird to have a YOTTA prefix.
Default value: Disabled(//#define)
